abstract: California has managed to borrow $5 billion in the credit markets, the state treasurer announced Thursday, averting a severe cash shortage that could have led to service cuts and layoffs. But more fiscal troubles loomed on the horizon there, The New York Times Randal C. Archibold reported.
lead_paragraph: California has managed to borrow $5 billion in the credit markets, the state treasurer announced Thursday, averting a severe cash shortage that could have led to service cuts and layoffs. But more fiscal troubles loomed on the horizon there, The New York Times Randal C. Archibold reported.

headline.main: California Finds Lenders in Credit Markets
